results.title: Round the twist: the gum-leaf war
results.creator_credit: Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Paul Jennings
results.brief_description: Dreaming that she has a huge nose, Linda takes her problems to Aunt Tuneless’ shack in the mountains where a war is in progress. People can inflict their own ailments on others by playing the gum leaves from a twisted tree.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard, Australian Children’s Television Foundation and Paul Jennings

results.title: Round the twist: Santa Claws
results.creator_credit: Mark Lewis, Antonia Barnard, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Paul Jennings
results.brief_description: Pete’s dream comes true when he meets Santa Claws Number 115,302 who grants each member of the Twist family two wishes, something they all end up wishing had never happened.

results.title: Round the twist: spaghetti pig out
results.creator_credit: Steve Steve Jodrell, Antonia Barnard, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Paul Jennings
results.brief_description: Chaos reigns after a bolt of lightning hits the video remote control - it works on people! Pause, rewind and fast-forward have amusing consequences, particularly at the spaghetti eating competition.

results.title: Round the twist: the cabbage patch fib
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Paul Jennings
results.brief_description: Believing that babies grow in the cabbage patch, Bronson actually finds one there. But he soon discovers that the responsibilities of parenthood have their drawbacks.

constellations_other.name: Cautionary tales and magic lantern projectors
constellations_other.description: Early magic lantern projections depicted cautionary religious scenes and fairytales, just like cinema did in its infancy.

results.title: Bellbird: Episode 205
results.creator_credit: Keith Wilkes, Oscar Whitbread and ABC
results.brief_description:
The ABC produced 1693 episodes of ‘Bellbird’ and the series ran for 10 years, until 1977. The series was a huge hit in rural and regional Australia because it dealt with the concerns of people living on the land and the dynamics of small country town life.
Episode 205 was broadcast on 1 January 1967.

results.title: Round the twist: birdsdo
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Paul Jennings
results.brief_description: Nell is committed to hospital for believing in dragons; so Linda, Pete and Bronson set off to prove her sanity. While rogue seagulls imprison Linda and Pete in a shack buried in bird droppings, Bronson finds the dragon’s egg and Nell is released.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard, Australian Children’s Television Foundation and Paul Jennings

results.title: Round the twist: skeleton on the dunny
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Antonia Barnard and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: When the Twists move from the city to live in an old lighthouse, they discover that the outside dunny is haunted. One stormy night they decide to have a showdown with a very flushed ghost.

results.title: Marco Solo
results.creator_credit: Adrian Bosich and VCA Film and Television School, University of Melbourne
results.brief_description:
Poor Marco. Accidentally born into an overcrowded Australian-Italian household, he is relegated to his parents’ bedroom. Nine years later, armed with a vivid imagination, an obsession with Dame Edna, and a warped sense of Catholicism, Marco searches for a space of his own. Cast includes Joseph Sollena, Robert Urban, Helen Nicholas, Irini Pappas, Maria Diele.
‘Marco Solo’ screened at many film festivals, including Palm Springs and London International Film Festival.

description_for_label:
Poor Marco. Accidentally born into an overcrowded Australian-Italian household, he is relegated to his parents’ bedroom. Nine years later, armed with a vivid imagination, an obsession with Dame Edna, and a warped sense of Catholicism, Marco searches for a space of his own. Cast includes Joseph Sollena, Robert Urban, Helen Nicholas, Irini Pappas, Maria Diele.
‘Marco Solo’ screened at many film festivals, including Palm Springs and London International Film Festival.

results.title: Blue Tongue
results.creator_credit: Justin Kurzel, Timothy Jolley and VCA Film and Television School, University of Melbourne
results.brief_description:
On the fringes of a housing estate a girl seduces a boy with a secret she will only reveal in exchange for his love. When the boy fails to honour the pact, what he holds close is threatened by the girl’s desire for revenge. Cast: Arlan Fahey Leigh and Siana Smit.
In 2005 ‘Blue Tongue’ was the first Australian short film to be selected for screening at the International Critics Week at the Cannes International Film Festival.
